title: Urgot's Q feels unimpactful
body:
For how hard it is to land the Q I feel like it's a bit underwhelming. If I remmember correctly old Urgot had armor reduction in his kit, could we readd that in his new Q to make it feel more impactful?
For example target hit by the Q, has it's armor reduced by 20% for 4 seconds. That would enforce Urgot' new nature as tank buster/ counter engager. 
And if you think that would make him too oppresive in the laning phase, just make the % shred scale with Q ranks,like 4%/8%/12%/16%/20% shred at ranks 1—5.

replies.body:
this is coming from a fairly experienced NEW urgot player , what i have concluded from the many games ive had in ranked , his kit is waaay too simple to dodge and very easy to play against , almost every single ability of his has a delay or clunky animation , so many restriction and downsides to his kit:

-Q has a massive delay , while also being just a generic slowing ability (doesnt feel like it actually rewards you for doing anything exept the lock on part)

-W relies on you being in melee form of the enemy or landing your Q while also having to be nearby and it also slows you down HEAVILY 

-E's animation windup feels really clunky to use and just not smooth at all 

-his base ms is quite low 

-his passive shotgun dmg is quite low early and has a fairly long cooldown being 30% total ad at lvl 1 and 30 seconds cooldown as well 

-his ult is EXTREMLY EASY to dodge unless your stuck between a rock and hard place

TLDR : Urgot needs buffs , but not necessarily a scaling type of buff or base damage buff , he just needs QoL changes at this point and make his kit feel smooth to use and rewarding when used correctly , dont get me wrong , he is quite strong if hes ahead , but that happens very rarely specially against lane bullies and ranged matchups

I agree with this a lot. As a big pre- and post-rework Urgot player, I do think he needs more reliability (or _something_) in his kit. One of the frustrating things that I've found (and perhaps this is just me, in which case I'd love to hear what anyone has to say!) is that it's hard to find a place in mid-to-late-game (in particular when I've been snowballing well but my team hasn't), because he's too slow to be an effective split-pusher (in theory you might be able to duel someone who tries to stop you, but if more than one comes, you're screwed) and team fights are super awkward if you can't single anyone out to use your spell rotation on, and once you're done with your spell rotation you either clumsily keep auto-attacking until your CDs are up again, or you clumsily try to waddle out until your CDs are up. I've done picks, I suppose, with Urgot. Anyway, I guess I wish there was _something_ to do in Urgot's down time (when W is on CD) or feel like I could contribute more meaningfully to a team fight, and I definitely don't think (nor want) the answer to be more damage/higher ratios.

I don't know how much this is useful, but it's what came to mind.

How are you building him? I've only played him twice but I built him pure damage and a single rotation of my W would kill people.

Don't think I even cast Q or E. Frozen mallet was a good enough slow.

Course again only played him twice in normals so shrug maybe his damage really does suck.

Mm, I agree, but it feels like it's suppose to lead into your abilities more then just kill things. 

Like use a Q to get a slow, then E in while they're chances of dodging are lowered, then activate W for chunks of damage. 

And since the new Urgot buys Black Cleaver first and it works really well with his W, then they would basically have little to know armor at the end of it. 

Just theory crafting though.

Pretty much is entirely matchup dependant. Half the time you are just waiting for them to hop on you so you can buffer your E through their CC then Q them while they're stunned and go ham with W + Passive.

OR, you do the same thing with E but then W and chase until they are starting to edge out of your W then Q them to keep them in.

Vs ranged champs or during ganks is pretty much the only time you should be using Q before E since the simple act of you moving towards them makes a leading Q shot alot more reliable to land.

Otherwise Q is pretty useless on it's own when doing the lane dance cuz it's extremely easy to dodge. Gotta play into it.

i often max it first for the bigger slow and damage and just drop it underneath low hp cannon minions :P

if they want the gold they are gonna have to take the damages
lol i guess you could. The increased shield and AD ratio on W is pretty massive tho. Considering its 2.5 attack speed x % AD ratio it's def worth increasing that ratio.

you can do that, but i often find it not neccessary 

thing is it also gets better with levels

and you need your Q to lock on and get the bigger slow to walk around them 

much of the damage comes from your passive anyway and the bigger ratio isn't that big of a deal especially if you build cleaver first since it doesn't give a gigantic amount of ad anyway.

you will start to get the amounts of ad & hp to warrant leveling W after your cleaver is completed and you start building your next item.

You also don't need it for the cooldown since your passive won't keep up anyway until later

So i tend to just max Q as i think it has the most benefit to leveling it first

What gets better with levels? W doesn't scale with level at all just HP, AD and rank.

And I don't find myself ever actually *needing* Q to do anything tbh. It helps now and then as a minor slow to get just a tad more in range but that's about it. I don't worry about people walking out of W because for a few reasons.

1. It's honestly more of a defensive tool especially in a ton of all-in matchups
2. You have Black Cleaver to speed you up during it
3. Typically also get Frozen Mallet. The only time you don't is when you don't have to cuz people are gonna have to stand in your W for team comp reasons.
4. E keeps them in W just fine on its own.

(+ 20 / 24 / 28 / 32 / 36% AD)

^ that's some major scaling. That is nowhere near minor. Remember it's (+ 20 / 24 / 28 / 32 / 36% AD) x 2.5 AS x 5 sec.

That's definitely not minor at all imo.

it's actually 3.0 attack speed and it scales with 30% bonus hp 

it's not minor, but i wouldn't call it major either it equates to about 108% AD per second vs 60% or 72%, sometimes i put an extra point in there in some matchups
But the difference isn't that big considering how much AD you are going to have before you actually get cleaver

i just value the increased slow and base damage on a lower cooldown Q during the early game since i can poke harder, deny cs, slow incoming enemy junglers more or help better if mine ganks 
And it can help farm at a safer distance and push waves a bit harder with the area damage



''W doesn't scale with level at all just HP, AD and rank.''
Your AD scales with levels too therefore the ability itself also scales up when you level up 

All things considered you gain more net damage early game from maxing Q, that is if you can reliably hit them. You also gain some aditional utility 

and there is another thing to consider, the slow itself is more valuable in the earlygame when your enemies are slower as it will allow you to fully utilize all your passive shots if you play it right.

And the final benefit which comes from maxing Q first is that since your W gets stronger with levels due to base ad ratio you don't actually put all your eggs in one basket damage wise. 

There are a lot of things to consider for which of the 2 to max first however whatever works best for you is probably what you should stick too until you are comfortable to change things up.

Sion, my main, scales similarly ability wise and while Q max seems like a good idea E max is generally better. for many of the same reasons and some different ones ofc. 


I will say this, ive tested both in practice tool extensively as well as played him (with extreme success) on normal games and in my experience maxing Q first yields the greatest benefits damage wise, mana consumption wise and utility wise. 

Oh and one last tip, you might like to know

warlords bloodlust is his best keystone, not neccesarily for the sustain, but mostly for the speedboosts which you can extremely rapidly charge up with purge, allowing for you to Q at the start of a fight and get the speedboost to bypass your opponent if they get to close, thats when you purge, this way you can get an extra speedboost during purge to walk a circle around your opponent and use your E to get the final shotgunleg shots, if you maxed Q here it should be back up again for another nuke/slow  or as zoning to force people to take a longer walk to safety while you keep shooting them

This is how i got my first bloods ^^

It's possible he is simply viable in both playstyles right now. I've definitely heard a friend say they max Q first and they win games and I see top players with wins that maxed Q (probuilds, not a very reliable source but they're usually my general build guides). Maybe having a different keystone as you said (Warlords) plays into that.

I run Fervor and most likely *because* I am maxing W. Because every shot of his W will proc a stack of fervor and therefore increase his W damage over time and with the much higher ratio from maxing it it ends up doing a ton early on and I end up being able to duel people like Riven (also due to the increased shield). I currently have a 67% winrate with Urgot in ranked at Plat 1 and I mainly play him as a counterpick to Rivens (I think like 40%ish of my games are vs Riven) but I've definitely won lane almost every game and I max W every time.

I've yet to have a lane matchup that just feels like I have a lower chance of winning or winning at all when I max W. Including Teemo and Jax who can potentially negate your W (you just kinda... don't W lol until they use their thing).

I suppose he is viable with both playstyles.

i do run very different builds on him then most players though, which is why i take warlords but i do see the benefit of taking fervor.

This is what i have built on Urgot so far

{{item:3047}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3075}} 

with 2 spellvamp quints 1 lifesteal quint,  alongside scaling resists and lethality runes and vampirism + warlords masteries

You get insanely tanky, and the sustain is pretty bonkers lol, and the additional shield from BT which you keep after W is a nice touch, they have to break through W shield first before BT's gets touched.

The sustain makes up for the lack of earlygame defense runes and i generally grab corrupting pot or dorans shield and are pretty much impossible to bully out of lane :P

It's a solid build which is strong all game long, it lacks a bit of early level 1-3 power but the sustain let's you win the trades after which your enemy can no longer win all in fights because they are half hp and you are not, beyond that slight weak point this build only becomes stronger.

My other build is much more late game oriented and has a more difficult start but once it comes online you can pretty much 1v5 

{{item:3047}} {{item:3042}} {{item:3071}}{{item:3812}}  {{item:3001}} {{item:3065}} 
Use the same rune/mastery setup
Although i sometimes opt for additional armor quints instead since the build lacks armor

The interesting thing about this setup is muramana and it's interaction with the other items in the build
Important to note is that _muramana does not get it's damage reduced to 1/3th on purge_ as it isn't an on hit effect allowing you to deal obscene amounts of damage

Abyssal mask makes sure your mana stays topped off as you take damage while granting healing on each muramana proc further enhanced by DD, SV & runic armor mastery. Alongside of this the DD will heal on your regular damage too
You will be healing for 300-400 per second xD 
But the pest part is how obscene the damage is, in the games i played this, a few times in ascension i managed to 1v5 the enemy team and take at least 3 or 4 people down before they could kill me and a few times i actually managed to win :S

Shit is plain broken ^^

My games never go long enough to reach 6 items. I only get 4 max.

That Muramana thing is interesting lol. If it were more easily stackable I'd consider it. If I ever get into a 120 minute game I'll build it haha.

I typically just go Black Cleaver and Righteous Glory/Steraks... and that's about it. If the game goes longer I get a the other... it never goes longer lol.

yes you are right games end quickly, that is why the muramana build isn't that feasible right now since you would have to build it first and it's not as easy to stack anymore as it was with pre rework urgot.

Build it later and you might not get it online. 

And sitting on tear isn't really useful either because that charges even slower and delays build anyway

Righteous glory is an interesting one, definitely helps with getting on top of people xD used to build it on Sion for his passive :P

> [{quoted}](name=EnderFighter,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=V5kyANsR,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-08-13T21:01:33.984+0000)
>
> Mm, I agree, but it feels like it's suppose to lead into your abilities more then just kill things. 

Have you seen his ultimate? I think _just killing things_ is kinda his shtick. :P
The problem is that his q is so easy to dodge, that when you actually hit it it does almost nothing. The slow is pretty much irrelevant considering how low it is.
Old Urgot had damage reduction not armor reduction in his kit
Old Urgot's E shredded armour.
And was a physical dot so it stacked Cleaver as well.
oh yes

just increase the ratio by a good 10 or even 20% that's really all it needs, it just simply doesn't do enough damage for his primary spell

I get that his main damage tool is supposed to be his passive and his ultimate execution takes up his power budget but his Q is a pretty lame damage tool and doesn't have the great AD scaling of other Juggernaut's Q's like Darius, Garen, and Yorick. 

lower the base and give it some oomph to match the damage of other juggernauts, such as making it pass 100% AD in exchange for a lower base (like most other juggs) would be perfect

Urgot's entire kit is clunky and unfluid. Slow, I could understand, he's "the Dreadnought" and all, but big things have a sort of grace and deliberateness to them, regardless of speed. Urgot lacks that in every animation.
Urgot's ultimate is too easy to dodge. It's not even skillful to land; your opponent has to suck to get hit by it.

Well a trick for a guaranteed ult, is to use it right after you sucessfully flip with e, since it also stuns them for 0,75 seconds, so you can tag them with ult if you know that within those 3 seconds you will be able to get them to 25%.

^ this

For an ability that does a lousy 25% health execute (AD lee does more with his) on a long ass cooldown you'd think you could actually hit the side of a building with it at least. Easiest skillshot to walk to the left and avoid IMO. At least when ww's ult became a skillshot, you could control the range and the hitbox is pretty big.

> [{quoted}](name=Tormentula,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=V5kyANsR,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-08-13T20:01:08.522+0000)
>
> ^ this
> 
> For an ability that does a lousy 25% health execute (AD lee does more with his) on a long ass cooldown you'd think you could actually hit the side of a building with it at least. Easiest skillshot to walk to the left and avoid IMO. At least when ww's ult became a skillshot, you could control the range and the hitbox is pretty big.

Long ass CD?  That thing is super short for an execute of that power.  120 is average cd but you lose 25 cd per rank, it goes 120/95/70.  With just 20% CDR from cleaver that's 96/76/56 CD, basically a minute and a half or less for the ability to one shot someone below 25% HP.  The thing is pretty delayed and easy to miss because it's low CD, you're basically guaranteed one every teamfight after early game.
First Riot need to fix his tankiness, then they can add a little power to him.

Honestly, I feel his tankiness is fine as is. Considering he has a low win rate (around 45 I think) I feel giving him buffs without nerfing him first is the right way to go. If he ends up being OP after then, then they can nerf him.

I feel like another reason why his winrate is partially low, is because Urgot truely shines when you have a tanky jungler that can frontline for the team, allowing Urgot to do his own thing in tfs. He is not a frontliner. Games where Im Urgot top and my jungler is Master Yi or Kha Zix or any other paper jungler usually go poorly for me, just can't be effective in tfs.
I feel Urgot also struggles in teamfights. He's not got any inbuilt sustain, after the shield from W is gone he can't get his HP back.
Well the w max in lane pretty much makes Urgot unbeatable 1 vs 1 ,because it gives him damage and shield to survive any retaliation.

Unbeatable 1v1? Every top lane can 1v1 Urgot but maybe Kayn. You seem to forget, Urgot doesn't have an ultimate because it's cast time and travel time are so garbage, which is why his diamond+ playrate is near nonexistent.
Just E them and then ult behind you.

Don't want to sound sassy but "Just E" as if it was an easy acomplishment :c his whole kit is extremely hard to land, and all of it backfires if you fail, Q you have to be in the short range, and doesn't do much. W needs Q, and once you hit Q aswell as W you'll be self-slowed. E is short ranged, telegraphed annd... if you fail it T_T
I've tried several of my champions against Urgot and have yet to find one that can actually handle his 1v1.
Champions with sustain later on can do well against him.
Try range champions or ones that can kite. I found GP good at kiting him around.

I've been saying this since day one, the issue is that his ult is really really really powerful so they allocated too much power into the ult. However the ult can be QSS'd and blocked by other ults so makes that power allocation a tad less useful. I honestly want more damage on the Q over the armor reduction as you can actually build {{item:3071}} and get that armor reduction but you build damage and you'll harm yourself for being squishier and the Q still not doing that much damage.
I feel you man. I played New Urgot but his Q ain't that strong. He really gets most of his power from his Passive.
I'm kinda suprised they didn't buff him this patch tbh, as it seems pretty clear he needs some buffs of some kind.

You mean to say, using the ability is not satisfying.  
That in fact would be a problem, as one of the focuses of the riot team is to make every ability feel satisfying.

Like Jhin.  Landing his abilities... Ooooooooh, yes.
While his ult feels overwhelming. So what?

Overwhelming? C'mon it's 25% for anyone without tank items that's only 500 damage or so. It's also easily dodged. If any thing it should also be immune to cleanses and other ults.

Late game karthus ult is undodgeable (baring specific cases) and deal's 1k+ to 5x people for over 5k damage just for pressing R.

Ori ult deals more if it hits more than 2 people.

Viegar deals more

Hell I think garen ult deals more if your the villian.

Yea sure it's a decent tank buster. But as a tank you WANT the enemy to be focusing you.

> [{quoted}](name=Jorencice,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=V5kyANsR,comment-id=000e0000,timestamp=2017-08-14T13:46:16.422+0000)
>
> Overwhelming? C'mon it's 25% for anyone without tank items that's only 500 damage or so. It's also easily dodged. If any thing it should also be immune to cleanses and other ults.
> 
> Late game karthus ult is undodgeable (baring specific cases) and deal's 1k+ to 5x people for over 5k damage just for pressing R.
> 
> Ori ult deals more if it hits more than 2 people.
> 
> Viegar deals more
> 
> Hell I think garen ult deals more if your the villian.
> 
> Yea sure it's a decent tank buster. But as a tank you WANT the enemy to be focusing you.

It's ***ONLY 500 TRUE DAMAGE EXECUTE?*** Do you have a slightest idea how many times an adc would have to attack a 500HP tank in order to kill him? Even {{champion:122}} with full Fervor stacks and Black Cleaver doesn't deal 500 True damage at level 1 ulti.

I said without tank items.

Against a tank it's around 750-1k damage.

Which is a fair bit of damage but DEFINATLY isn't overwhelming.

Also at level 6... an adc or tank would only have like 900-1400 health or so

Which means a DODGEABLE ULT that has a trigger condition would only 200-350 damage.

So great job proving my point. Darius ult deals more damage than urgots ult and is easier to trigger.
Janna's W also feels unimpactful, let's buff her as well
Agreed. I want either a heal or a 3rd knockup.
Please no armor shred.

I usually start off with a Death Dance and max Q and W evenly before putting more than that one point into E.

With enough AD early on it feels pretty strong, and DD's bleed tick + lifesteal is great. You really gotta lay down the harass though--and if you're gonna push make sure your lane opponent is weak enough to not be a huge threat when the jungler comes.
they should take power from his W shield and put it in Q either more slow or more dmg
